title: Calories in 100g of Potatoes
meta_description: Discover calories in 100g of potatoes, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown per 100g, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Boiled potatoes, flesh only, no skin, no added salt, butter, or oil; medium-sized russet variety.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato type, cooking method, skin inclusion, and additions like butter or seasonings. Check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of boiled potatoes provides ~86 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of boiled potatoes?
faqs.a: About 86 kcal for boiled potatoes without skin or additions.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 100g of potatoes?
faqs.a: Approximately 20 g carbs, including 1.8 g fiber and 0.9 g sugars.

faqs.q: Do potatoes have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low amounts: ~1.9 g protein and 0.1 g fat per 100 g boiled.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in potatoes?
faqs.a: Boiling keeps calories low (~86 kcal/100g); frying or adding oil/butter increases them significantly.

faqs.q: Are sweet potatoes different in calories from regular?
faqs.a: Sweet potatoes have ~86 kcal/100g baked, similar to regular but with more vitamins.
